Events.name: Events
Events.description:
Browserify implementation of NodeJS Events module.

This is for *documentation purposes only*. 

The information herein was taken from NodeJS documentation and reformatted in JSDoc format.

Many objects in Node emit events: a net.Server emits an event each time a peer connects to it, a fs.readStream emits an event when the file is opened. All objects which emit events are instances of events.EventEmitter. You can access this module by doing: require("events");

Typically, event names are represented by a camel-cased string, however, there aren't any strict restrictions on that, as any string will be accepted.

Functions can then be attached to objects, to be executed when an event is emitted. These functions are called listeners. Inside a listener function, this refers to the EventEmitter that the listener was attached to.

parcel.name: parcel
parcel.description:
Represents a section of real state in the HTML page.

All Parcela apps should inherit from this class.

Several properties might be configured on instantiation:

* [containerType](#property_containerType)
* [className](#property_className)
* [attributes](#property_attributes)
* [text](#property_text)

parcelEv.name: parcelEv
parcelEv.description:
Subclass of [Parcel](Parcel.html) capable of listening and
relaying DOM events.

Besides the configuration attributes used by [Parcel](Parcel.html), 
`ParcelEv` accepts the `EVENTS` property which is a hash map of DOM events to listen to.

Each entry into `EVENTS` must contain the name of a DOM event (i.e.: `click`, `keypress`)
followed either by a listener function or a further object.   

* A function can be given as a reference or as a string with the name of the method within this class
  that handles it.  The function will be called whenever that event is fired.
* If an object, it should be a hash map of CSS selectors and functions.  
  This limits the kind of DOM element or elements whose events you want to listen to.  
  The function will then be called only when the element generating it satisfies the condition.

`ParcelEv` will queue a request to redraw the page unless any of the listeners cancels it by returning a **truish** value.

`ParcelEv` is also an `EventEmitter` thus, it will have methods to deal with custom events.
See: [NodeJS EventEmitter](https://nodejs.org/docs/latest/api/events.html)

radio.name: radio
radio.description:
Provides a set of HTML radio buttons optionally enclosed in a `<fieldset>`.
Emits the [`click`](#event_click) when clicked.

virtual-DOM.name: virtual-DOM
virtual-DOM.description: Provides virtual dom functionality for other modules.

EventEmitter.name: EventEmitter
EventEmitter.description:
To access the EventEmitter class, require('events').EventEmitter.

When an EventEmitter instance experiences an error, the typical action is to emit an 'error' event. Error events are treated as a special case in node. If there is no listener for it, then the default action is to print a stack trace and exit the program.

All EventEmitters emit the event 'newListener' when new listeners are added and 'removeListener' when a listener is removed.

Parcel.description:

Several properties might be configured on instantiation:

params.name: config
params.description: Initial configuration.

ParcelEv.name: ParcelEv
ParcelEv.description:
Subclass of [Parcel](Parcel.html) capable of listening and
relaying DOM events.

Besides the configuration attributes used by [Parcel](Parcel.html), 
`ParcelEv` accepts the `EVENTS` property which is a hash map of DOM events to listen to.

Each entry into `EVENTS` must contain the name of a DOM event (i.e.: `click`, `keypress`)
followed either by a listener function or a further object.   

* A function can be given as a reference or as a string with the name of the method within this class
  that handles it.  The function will be called whenever that event is fired.
* If an object, it should be a hash map of CSS selectors and functions.  
  This limits the kind of DOM element or elements whose events you want to listen to.  
  The function will then be called only when the element generating it satisfies the condition.

`ParcelEv` will queue a request to redraw the page unless any of the listeners cancels it by returning a **truish** value.

`ParcelEv` is also an `EventEmitter` thus, it will have methods to deal with custom events.
See: [NodeJS EventEmitter](https://nodejs.org/docs/latest/api/events.html)

params.name: config
params.description: Initial configuration

Radio.name: Radio
Radio.description:
Provides a set of HTML radio buttons optionally enclosed in a `<fieldset>`.
Emits the [`click`](#event_click) when clicked.

params.name: config
params.description: configuration options

props.name: opts
props.description: Set of options to choose from.  Each is an object with the value to identify each option as its key and the text to be shown as its value.	It has to be an array to ensure the order of the buttons.

props.name: title
props.description: If present, a `<fieldset>` will enclose the buttons and this set as its legend

props.name: groupName
props.description: A `name` to be assigned to the set of radios.  If not provided, a unique name will be generated.

vDOM.name: vDOM
vDOM.description: Contains the virtual DOM handling methods and properties

vNode.name: vNode
vNode.description:
Internal, virtual representation of an actual DOM node.
There are two sub-versions of it.

* For text nodes, the vNode will be an instance of String
  with an extra `node` property.
* For nodes corresponding to Parcel containers, the node
  will have the extra `parcel` and `stamp` properties.

The virtual DOM version differs from that produced by the
[Parcel.view](Parcel.html#method_view) method in that it has the `node`
property set.

This entry is just for documentation purposes.
There is no actual code for this class.  It is created as an object literal.

classitems.description: Adds a listener to the end of the listeners array for the specified event. No checks are made to see if the listener has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same combination of event and listener will result in the listener being added multiple times.
classitems.name: addListener

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event to subscribe to

params.name: listener
params.description: Callback function to receive the event

classitems.description: Adds a listener to the end of the listeners array for the specified event. No checks are made to see if the listener has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same combination of event and listener will result in the listener being added multiple times.
classitems.name: on

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event to subscribe to

params.name: listener
params.description: Callback function to receive the event

classitems.description: Adds a one time listener for the event. This listener is invoked only the next time the event is fired, after which it is removed.
classitems.name: once

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event to subscribe to

params.name: listener
params.description: Callback function to receive the event

classitems.description: Remove a listener from the listener array for the specified event. Caution: changes array indices in the listener array behind the listener.
classitems.name: removeListener

params.name: name
params.description: identifier of the event to remove

params.name: listener
params.description: callback that handled the event

classitems.description:
Removes all listeners, or those of the specified event. It's not a good idea to remove listeners that were added elsewhere in the code, especially when it's on an emitter that you didn't create (e.g. sockets or file streams).

Returns emitter, so calls can be chained.
classitems.name: removeAllListeners

params.name: name
params.description: identifier of the events to be removed

classitems.description:
By default EventEmitters will print a warning if more than 10 listeners are added for a particular event. This is a useful default which helps finding memory leaks. Obviously not all Emitters should be limited to 10. This function allows that to be increased. Set to zero for unlimited.

Returns emitter, so calls can be chained.
classitems.name: setMaxListeners

params.name: n
params.description: maximum number of listeners to accept

classitems.description:
`setMaxListeners(n)` sets the maximum on a per-instance basis. This class property lets you set it for all EventEmitter instances, current and future, effective immediately. Use with care.

Note that emitter.setMaxListeners(n) still has precedence over EventEmitter.defaultMaxListeners.
classitems.name: defaultMaxListeners

classitems.description: Returns an array of listeners for the specified event.
classitems.name: listeners

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the listeners to count

classitems.description:
Execute each of the listeners in order with the supplied arguments.

Returns true if event had listeners, false otherwise.
classitems.name: emit

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event being emitted

params.name: arg*
params.description: Arguments to be provided to the listeners

return.description: true if event had listeners subscribed to it

classitems.description: Return the number of listeners for a given event.
classitems.name: ListenerCount

params.name: emitter
params.description: instance of a EventEmitter to check

params.name: name
params.description: identifier of the event

classitems.description: This event is emitted any time a listener is added. When this event is triggered, the listener may not yet have been added to the array of listeners for the event.
classitems.name: newListener

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event being subscribed

params.name: listener
params.description: the listener

classitems.description: This event is emitted any time someone removes a listener. When this event is triggered, the listener may not yet have been removed from the array of listeners for the event.
classitems.name: removeListener

params.name: name
params.description: Identifier of the event being subscribed

params.name: listener
params.description: the listener

classitems.description:
Type of DOM element that will be created to serve as a container for this Parcel.
Defaults to a `DIV`
classitems.name: containerType

classitems.description:
CSS className to add to the container for this parcel.
This is in addition to the className of `parcel` which is
automatically added to all Parcel containers.
classitems.name: className

classitems.description: Hash map of attributes for the container element
classitems.name: attributes

classitems.description:
String to be shown within the container.  

This is used, mostly, for initial testing of layouts, 
to have something to show within the parcel.  
It is rarely used in the final product.
classitems.name: text

classitems.description:
Destructor.  

The provided method checks all the instance properties and if any of them are 
instances of Parcel or arrays of Parcel instances, 
it will call the `destructor` method on each of the child parcels.

It is a last-resort tactic to avoid leaving stuff behind.
In practice, it should be overriden to destroy only what each parcel has created.
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description:
Called by the renderer before this Parcel is shown for the first time.
It is a good place to activate resources that are only usefull while the 
parcel is visible such as animations.

The provided method is empty, it can be overriden by each Parcela app.
classitems.name: preView

classitems.description:
Called by the renderer after this Parcel is hidden.

It is a good place to deactivate resources that are only usefull while the 
parcel is visible such as animations.

The provided method is empty, it can be overriden by each Parcela app.
classitems.name: postView

classitems.description:
Returns the virtual DOM for this parcel.

Must be overriden by each Parcela app.  By default, it returns the value of the [text](#property_text) property.

A virtual DOM node is composed of the following elements:

* `tag` {String}:  Name of the HTML tag for the node to be created.
* `attrs` {Object}: Collection of HTML attributes to be added to the node.
* `children` {Array}: Array of virtual DOM nodes that will become children of the created node.

As a convenience, this method receives a reference to the [`vDOM.vNode`](vDOM.html#method_vNode)
helper function to produce the virtual DOM node, however it may be ignored as long as a
virtual DOM node is somehow returned.
classitems.name: view

params.name: v
params.description: Reference to the [`vDOM.vNode`](vDOM.html#method_vNode) helper function.

return.description: The expected virtual DOM node for this parcel.

classitems.description:
Returns a value representative of the state of this parcel.
The system will compare it with the previous state and if they match,
it will assume the view has not changed.

The default function returns `NaN` which is always different than itself.
It may be overriden for optimization purposes.
classitems.name: stamp

return.description: any simple value (no objects or such) that reflects the state of this view

classitems.description: Overrides the original (empty) [preView](Parcel.html#method_preView) to set the event listeners
classitems.name: preView

classitems.description:
Overrides the original (empty) [postView](Parcel.html#method_postView)
to detach the event listeners.
classitems.name: postView

classitems.description: Extends the original destructor method so as to detach all the event listeners
classitems.name: destructor

classitems.description: Emitted when a button is clicked.  It reports the `value` of the radio selected
classitems.name: click

params.name: value
params.description: value of the option seleted

params.name: ev
params.description: original DOM event

classitems.description: Overrides Parcel's [view](Parcel.html#method_view) method to generate the set of radio buttons
classitems.name: view

classitems.description: Hash of special `tagNames` that imply change in the XML namespacing.
classitems.name: _xmlNS

classitems.description: The virtual DOM for the application.
classitems.name: _vDOM

classitems.description:
Helper function to build [vNodes](vNode.html).

It takes the name of the `tag` to be created.
It supports the following four modifiers, following the rules of CSS selectors:

* A `namespace` prefix followed by a colon:  `svg:line` (not needed, see note below)
* One or more CSS classes, each preceeded by a dot: `div.list`
* An `id` preceeded by a pound: `div#a1`
* One or more attribute assignments, each enclosed in square brackets: `input[type=checkbox]`

Though the last three modifiers can be set via the `attrs` argument,
for performance reasons, if they won't change during the application
it is better to set them via the above modifiers and reserve
the attributes for variable parts.

If modifiers are used, the tagName itself can be omitter and a `div` will be assumed.
Thus, `#a1` is the same as `div#al`.

Attributes `className` (or `class`) and `style` have special treatment.

The `className` attribute can be given as a string or as an array of values, the last being preferable.

The `style` attribute should be set with an object containing a hash map of style names to values.
The style names should be in JavaScript format, not CSS format that is, `backgroundColor` not `background-color`.

*Pending:* Neither the `svg:` or the `math:` namespaces are required.  The renderer will add the corresponding
`xmlns` attribute upon detecting the `<svg>` or `<math>` elements.  All elements contained within
any of those will be properly namespaced.
classitems.name: vNode

params.name: tag
params.description:
Name of the tag to be created.
 Much like with a CSS selector,
 it can be followed by a `#` and an ID,
 any number of CSS classNames each preceded by a `.`
 and attribute assignments enclosed in square brackets (see example above).

params.name: attrs
params.description:
Collection of attributes to be set on the node.
 Any value assigned to the `className` attribute will be appended to those provided along the tag.

params.name: children
params.description:
It can be a further virtual DOM node, a parcel,
a simple value which will result in a text string or an array of either.

classitems.description:
Triggers the rendering process for the page or a specific parcel.

The rendering process starts with the production of a new virtual DOM for the page or component
and a comparisson of the newly created *expected* DOM against the *existing* DOM.
The render process will only change those nodes in the actual DOM that differ in between the two.

Called without any arguments, it will start the process at the root of the virtual DOM.
If provided with an argument it will start the process at the branch of the virtual DOM
controlled by the given Parcel instance.
classitems.name: render

params.name: parcel
params.description: Instance of Parcel in control of a section of a page.

classitems.description:
Determines which [Parcel](Parcel.html) is the root app for this page
and which is the DOM element it corresponds to and renders the app.

If the root app controls the whole screen, the corresponding DOM element is going to be
`document.body`, which is the default when omitted.
classitems.name: rootApp

params.name: Parcel
params.description: instance of [Parcel](Parcel.html) that is the root of the app.

params.name: element
params.description: DOM element that is the root of the app.

params.name: parcelConfig
params.description: optional arguments to provide to Parcel when intantiating it.

return.description: the root parcel just created (available in the [rootParcel](#property_rootParcel) property).

classitems.description:
Warns the rendering system that a redraw will be required, 
but it should hold on until the operation about to be performed 
(usually an async one) is finished,
[redrawReady](#method_redrawReady) should then be called.
classitems.name: redrawPending

classitems.description:
Signals that the operation that would require a redraw has been finished
and that, if no further async operations are pending, it may now proceed.
Optionally, it may cancel the rendering.
It should be used paired with [redrawPending](#method_redrawPending).
classitems.name: redrawReady

params.name: cancel
params.description: If present and truish, the redraw will be cancelled.

classitems.description:
Executes the given function `fn` on all parcels in the vDOM
starting from the given `parcel`.
classitems.name: _forAllPNodes

params.name: parcel
params.description: parcel to start executing from

params.name: fn
params.description: function to execute on each parcel

classitems.description:
Calls `postView` on all the parcels in the branch starting
at the given `parcel`
classitems.name: _postViews

params.name: parcel
params.description: parcel to start calling `postView` on.

classitems.description: Returns a new `pNode` based on the given parcel and namspace.
classitems.name: _buildPNode

params.name: parcel
params.description: Parcel instance that serves as the basis for this parcel

params.name: namespace
params.description: current XML namespace URL

params.name: parentPNode
params.description: The pNode that is the ancestor of this one.

return.description: a new `pNode` based on the given parcel

classitems.description: Returns a new `vNode` based on the given `tag` and `namespace`
classitems.name: _buildVNode

params.name: tag
params.description: nodeName of the DOM node to be created.

params.name: namespace
params.description: current XML namespace URL

classitems.description: Returns a string node.
classitems.name: _buildStringNode

params.name: Text
params.description: to make the string node of

classitems.description: Skips over Parcels whose stamp has not changed, looking for nested parcels within
classitems.name: _skipPNode

params.name: children
params.description: Array of children to lookk into

classitems.description: Runs the differences in between an existing and the expected `pNodes`
classitems.name: _diffPNode

params.name: existing
params.description: The existing `pNode`

params.name: parcel
params.description: parcel that will supply the new pNode to compare against

params.name: parentPNode
params.description: The pNode that is the ancestor of this one.

classitems.description:
Runs the difference between an existing and the expected `vNode`
and makes the necessaty changes on the DOM based on the differences.
At the end, the existing should match the expected.
classitems.name: _diffVNodes

params.name: existing
params.description: Branch of the virtual DOM that represents the actual, current DOM

params.name: expected
params.description: The same branch as it should become

params.name: namespace
params.description: current XML namespace URL

params.name: parentPNode
params.description: The pNode that is the ancestor of this one.

classitems.description:
Compares the children of the existing and the expected vDOM and makes the necessary
changes so it updates to the expected.
classitems.name: _diffChildren

params.name: parentEl
params.description: Element that contains the children represented by the existing vNode

params.name: existing
params.description: virtual representation of the actual DOM

params.name: expected
params.description: virtual representation of how it should be

params.name: namespace
params.description: current XML namespace URL

params.name: parentPNode
params.description: The pNode that is the ancestor of this one.

classitems.description:
Compares the attributes of the existing virtual DOM and the expected
and makes the differences.
classitems.name: _diffAttrs

params.name: existing
params.description: vNode whose attributes represent the current state

params.name: expected
params.description: vNode whose attributes are the new expected state

params.name: namespace
params.description: current XML namespace URL

classitems.description:
Compares the new and old list of classNames and
if there is any difference, it sets the whole thing at once.
classitems.name: _diffClassNames

params.name: existing
params.description: virtual DOM node to apply this classNames to

params.name: value
params.description: Object literal containing the current values

params.name: newValue
params.description: Object literal containin the new values

classitems.description: Compares the new and old styles and fixes the differences in the DOM
classitems.name: _diffStyles

params.name: existing
params.description: virtual DOM node to apply this styles to

params.name: value
params.description: Object literal containing the current values

params.name: newValue
params.description: Object literal containin the new values

classitems.description:
Represents the DOM `tagName` or node type.
Corresponds to the HTML element type.
classitems.name: tag

classitems.description:
The value of the `xmlns` attribute for namespaced elements
such as `svg`.
classitems.name: namespace

classitems.description:
DOM node corresponding to the virtual node.
It is only present in the internal vDOM and only assigned
after the DOM has been rendered.
classitems.name: node

classitems.description:
Collection of the attributes of the DOM element.
It is an hash map of attribute names to attribute values.
classitems.name: attrs

classitems.description:
Array of children nodes of this node.
The children can be either
* further vNodes,
* pNodes
* plain values which will be converted to strings or tNodes
classitems.name: children

classitems.description:
Reference to the [Parcel](Parcel.html) instance that has produced this pNode
and its descendants.
classitems.name: parcel

classitems.description:
Value returned by the [`stamp()`](Parcel.html#method_stamp) method
to compare whether the parcel contents has changed
classitems.name: stamp
